Class Track

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • Track
  • public abstract class Track
extends greenfoot.Actor
    Represents a part of a track of a railway
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Leonard Bienbeck

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected java.lang.String imageBaseName
      The core part of the file name of the image to be drawn into the Greenfoot world to represent this object.
      protected java.lang.String layoutBlockId
      The name of the layout block to which this piece of track belongs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Track​(java.lang.String imageBaseName)
      Creates a track with the given core part of the file name of the image representing it, but without assignment to a layout block.
      Track​(java.lang.String imageBaseName, java.lang.String layoutBlockId)
      Creates a track with the given core part of the file name of the image representing it and assigns it the given layout block.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void act()  
      protected void addedToWorld​(greenfoot.World world)  
      java.lang.String getLayoutBlock()
      Returns the name of the layout block to which the track belongs.
      protected boolean isBlockActive()
      Indicates whether the layout block to which the track belongs is active, i.e. whether there is currently a train on it.
      void move​(int distance)
      A track does not move; therefore nothing happens when this method is called.
      void setLayoutBlock​(java.lang.String layoutBlockId)
      Assigns the layout block with the given name to the track.
      abstract void updateImage()
      Abstract method by which the subclasses determine how the image representing the track is generated.

      • Track

        public Track​(java.lang.String imageBaseName,
             java.lang.String layoutBlockId)
        Creates a track with the given core part of the file name of the image representing it and assigns it the given layout block.
        Parameters:
        imageBaseName - The core part of the file name of the image representing the track
        layoutBlockId - The name of the layout block to which the track belongs

    • Method Detail

      • setLayoutBlock

        public void setLayoutBlock​(java.lang.String layoutBlockId)
        Assigns the layout block with the given name to the track.
        Parameters:
        layoutBlockId - The name of the layout block to which the track belongs

      • getLayoutBlock

        public java.lang.String getLayoutBlock()
        Returns the name of the layout block to which the track belongs.
        Returns:
        The name of the layout block to which the track belongs

      • isBlockActive

        protected boolean isBlockActive()
        Indicates whether the layout block to which the track belongs is active, i.e. whether there is currently a train on it.
        Returns:
        true if the block is active; false if the block is not active or no block is assigned to the track

      • updateImage

        public abstract void updateImage()
        Abstract method by which the subclasses determine how the image representing the track is generated. This usually takes into account the state of the track, for example whether it is occupied or, in the case of turnouts, whether they are thrown or closed.

      • addedToWorld

        protected void addedToWorld​(greenfoot.World world)
        Overrides:

        public void act()
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor

      • move

        public void move​(int distance)
        A track does not move; therefore nothing happens when this method is called.
        Overrides:
